base_device: A handheld hardware controller device with: small LCD screen at top showing text, large central rotary knob/dial with knurled metal texture, 6 context buttons (CTX 1-6) arranged around the knob, bottom row of action buttons (YES, NO, OTHER, microphone, SEND, CHAT), colorful LED backlighting under buttons, coiled cable attached

styles.name: Carved Wood
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller carved entirely from rich dark walnut wood, like a luxury chess piece. The rotary knob is polished smooth wood with visible grain. Buttons are inlaid lighter maple wood with burned-in labels. The LCD screen is set into the wood like a jewel. Warm wood tones, craftsman aesthetic, visible wood grain throughout. Studio lighting on neutral background.
styles.reasoning: Shows premium craftsmanship, appeals to audiophile/luxury market

styles.name: Resin with Embedded Flowers
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller made of clear epoxy resin with real dried flowers, leaves, and petals embedded inside the transparent body. Pink roses, lavender, baby's breath visible suspended in the clear material. Buttons are smooth resin domes with flowers inside each one. The rotary knob has a single perfect rose in the center. Ethereal, romantic, nature preserved in technology. Soft natural lighting.
styles.reasoning: Unique art piece, feminine aesthetic, nature meets tech

styles.name: Stained Glass
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller designed like a stained glass church window. The body is made of colorful glass pieces held together by dark lead caming. Deep reds, blues, golds, and greens. Light shines through the translucent colored glass sections. The LCD screen glows like illuminated manuscript. Gothic cathedral aesthetic. Buttons are individual glass jewels. Dramatic backlighting showing the colors.
styles.reasoning: Sacred/artistic feel, dramatic visual impact

styles.name: LEGO Bricks
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller built entirely from colorful LEGO bricks. Red, blue, yellow, green LEGO pieces snapped together to form the body. The rotary knob is a large round LEGO piece. Buttons are 2x2 LEGO studs in different colors. The LCD screen is a printed LEGO tile. Playful, nostalgic, toy-like. You can see the LEGO studs and connection points. Bright cheerful lighting.
styles.reasoning: Playful, nostalgic, appeals to makers/builders

styles.name: Concrete Brutalist
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller made of raw poured concrete, brutalist architecture style. Heavy, monolithic, gray concrete with visible form marks and aggregate texture. Buttons are pressed into the concrete as geometric shapes. The rotary knob is a smooth concrete cylinder. Minimal, industrial, museum sculpture aesthetic. The LCD screen is recessed into the concrete block. Dramatic shadows, architectural photography style.
styles.reasoning: Bold statement piece, appeals to architects/designers

styles.name: Art Deco
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller in Art Deco style from the 1920s. Geometric gold and black patterns. Sunburst motifs radiating from the rotary knob. Chrome and gold metallic finishes. Sharp angular shapes, symmetrical design. Buttons are geometric jewels - emerald, ruby, sapphire colored. The LCD has a gold decorative frame. Great Gatsby luxury aesthetic. Glamorous studio lighting with reflections.
styles.reasoning: Timeless elegance, luxury positioning

styles.name: Studio Ghibli
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller as if it were a magical artifact from a Studio Ghibli film. Whimsical, hand-crafted looking with slight imperfections. Warm brass and copper tones with verdigris patina. Small decorative details - tiny stars, moons, nature motifs. The rotary knob looks like an ancient compass. Soft magical glow emanates from within. Cozy, enchanted, like something Howl would own. Warm dreamy lighting.
styles.reasoning: Magical whimsy, beloved aesthetic, emotional appeal

styles.name: Vaporwave
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller in vaporwave aesthetic. Pink and purple gradient colors. Greek marble column textures mixed with 90s technology. Palm trees and sunset colors reflected in chrome surfaces. The LCD shows retro Japanese text. Glitchy, nostalgic, internet aesthetic. Chrome and holographic materials. Pink neon glow. Checkerboard floor reflection. Memphis design elements. Dreamy hazy pink/purple lighting.
styles.reasoning: Internet culture, nostalgic appeal, distinctive look

styles.name: Graffiti Street Art
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller covered in graffiti street art. Spray paint tags, drips, and wild style lettering covering every surface. Bright clashing colors - pink, yellow, electric blue, orange. The rotary knob has a cartoon character face painted on it. Stickers and wheat paste texture. Urban, rebellious, artistic. Looks like it was customized by a street artist. Gritty concrete background with more graffiti.
styles.reasoning: Urban culture, artistic expression, youth appeal

styles.name: Day of the Dead
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller decorated for Day of the Dead. Sugar skull patterns painted on the body. Marigold orange, hot pink, turquoise, and black colors. Intricate floral designs and skeleton motifs. The buttons are decorated like sugar skull eyes. Gold leaf accents. The rotary knob has a calavera (skull) design. Celebratory, vibrant, honoring tradition. Surrounded by marigold petals. Warm festive lighting.
styles.reasoning: Cultural celebration, vibrant colors, meaningful symbolism

styles.name: Underwater Coral Reef
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller that looks like it grew on a coral reef underwater. Encrusted with colorful coral, barnacles, and sea anemones. Small shells embedded in the surface. The buttons are like sea urchins or anemone tentacles. Bioluminescent blue and green glow from within. Seaweed wrapped around the cable. Fish swimming nearby. The rotary knob is a nautilus shell spiral. Underwater photography lighting, caustic light rays.
styles.reasoning: Organic beauty, environmental theme, unexpected

styles.name: Wizard's Tower Artifact
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller as an ancient magical artifact from a wizard's tower. Leather-bound edges like a spellbook. Brass gears and clockwork visible inside. Glowing runes and arcane symbols etched into the surface. Crystal buttons that pulse with inner light. The rotary knob is a mystical orb. Old parchment texture. Candle wax drips. The LCD shows magical script. Dusty tome aesthetic. Candlelit dramatic lighting.
styles.reasoning: Fantasy genre appeal, magical mystery

styles.name: Volcanic Lava
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller made of black volcanic obsidian rock, cracked to reveal glowing orange molten lava underneath. The cracks glow like magma veins. Buttons are cooled lava rocks with orange glow beneath. The rotary knob is smooth obsidian glass. Heat shimmer effect around it. Smoke wisping from the cracks. Dangerous, primal, elemental power. The LCD glows like fire. Dark background with orange lava glow illumination.
styles.reasoning: Dramatic contrast, elemental power, striking visual

styles.name: Candy Land
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller made entirely of candy and sweets. The body is chocolate with a bite taken out of one corner. Buttons are colorful gummy bears, jelly beans, and M&Ms. The rotary knob is a swirled lollipop. Frosting piped around the edges. Sprinkles scattered on top. The LCD screen is a candy wrapper. Cotton candy clouds around it. Sweet, playful, delicious looking. Bright candy shop lighting.
styles.reasoning: Fun, whimsical, unexpected material

styles.name: Alien Artifact
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller as an alien biomechanical artifact, HR Giger inspired. Organic ribbed textures mixed with mechanical parts. Dark iridescent surface like beetle shells. Buttons are organic pods that look alive. The rotary knob is a spiraling shell-like growth. Tubes and tendons connecting parts. Unsettling but beautiful. Bioluminescent accents. The LCD shows alien symbols. Dark atmospheric lighting with rim light.
styles.reasoning: Sci-fi aesthetic, unique and memorable

styles.name: Moroccan Tiles
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller covered in traditional Moroccan zellige tile patterns. Intricate geometric mosaics in cobalt blue, white, and gold. Hand-cut tile pieces forming star and flower patterns. The rotary knob is a decorative brass fixture. Buttons are individual mosaic sections. Islamic geometric art patterns. The body has the texture of glazed ceramic tiles. Warm North African lighting, perhaps in a riad courtyard setting.
styles.reasoning: Artisan craft, cultural beauty, intricate detail

styles.name: Filipino Jeepney
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller decorated like a Filipino Jeepney. Chrome everything - chrome horse hood ornaments, chrome trim, chrome buttons. Explosive colors - hot pink, electric blue, yellow, orange. Hand-painted flowers, eagles, and religious imagery. Disco ball reflections. Maximum decoration, no empty space. The LCD has decorative frame. Tassels and ornaments hanging. Festive, loud, proud, uniquely Filipino. Bright tropical lighting.
styles.reasoning: Celebration of Filipino culture, maximalist joy

styles.name: Japanese Ukiyo-e
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller painted in Japanese Ukiyo-e woodblock print style. The Great Wave off Kanagawa wrapping around the body. Cherry blossom branches across the surface. Mount Fuji on one side. Traditional indigo blue and white colors with red accents. The texture looks like printed on textured washi paper. Buttons are mon (family crest) designs. The rotary knob has a chrysanthemum pattern. Soft diffused lighting like a museum display.
styles.reasoning: Classic art, Japanese aesthetic, timeless beauty

styles.name: Scandinavian Minimal
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller in Scandinavian minimalist design. Pale blonde birch wood with white painted accents. Simple clean lines, no unnecessary decoration. Soft rounded corners. Buttons are smooth white ceramic or pale wood. The rotary knob is natural wood grain. Muted pastel accent colors - soft sage green, dusty pink. Cozy wool cable cover. Hygge aesthetic. The LCD has a simple clean font. Soft natural daylight, white background.
styles.reasoning: Clean design, mass appeal, calming aesthetic

styles.name: Mexican Talavera
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller decorated in Mexican Talavera pottery style. Hand-painted bright flowers, birds, and vines on white ceramic background. Cobalt blue, sunny yellow, terracotta orange, and grass green colors. Folk art patterns covering every surface. The buttons are small Talavera tiles. The rotary knob has a sunflower painted on it. Artisan hand-crafted imperfections. Cheerful, rustic, traditional Mexican folk art. Warm sunny lighting.
styles.reasoning: Folk art beauty, handmade aesthetic, warm colors

styles.name: Overgrown with Nature
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller that has been abandoned and overgrown with nature. Moss covering most of the surface. Small ferns and mushrooms growing from the cracks. Vines wrapping around the cable. A tiny flower blooming from one button. The LCD screen is cracked with a plant growing through it. Nature reclaiming technology. Beautiful decay. Soft forest lighting filtering through leaves.
styles.reasoning: Environmental message, beautiful impermanence

styles.name: Melting Dali Clock
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller melting like a Salvador Dali clock. The body is drooping and warping, draped over an edge. Buttons are sliding off, stretched like taffy. The rotary knob is elongated and bent. The LCD screen display is distorted and running. Surrealist dreamscape. Time and reality bending. Soft desert background with long shadows. Everything is melting but still somehow functional. Warm surreal lighting.
styles.reasoning: Art statement, surrealist appeal, memorable image

styles.name: Origami Paper
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller folded entirely from origami paper. Crisp geometric folds creating the 3D form. White paper with visible fold lines and creases. The buttons are small folded paper squares. The rotary knob is a complex origami spiral fold. Delicate, precise, mathematical beauty. Perhaps some sections in colored paper - red, gold. The cable is a paper chain. Soft even lighting showing the paper texture and shadows in the folds.
styles.reasoning: Craft aesthetic, geometric beauty, unexpected material

styles.name: Plush Stuffed Toy
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller as a soft plush stuffed toy. Made of fuzzy fleece and felt fabric. Buttons are embroidered or soft fabric circles. The rotary knob is a stuffed pom-pom that can spin. Cute button eyes added to make it look like a character. Soft pastel colors - mint green, baby pink, lavender. Visible stitching and seams. Huggable and soft. The LCD is embroidered text. Sitting on a child's bed. Soft warm lighting.
styles.reasoning: Cute factor, unexpected softness, kawaii appeal

styles.name: Made by a Child
styles.prompt: A VibeDeck controller as if designed and decorated by a 5-year-old child. Crayon drawings all over it - sun, stick figures, house, rainbow. Wobbly hand-drawn letters for the button labels. Stickers stuck randomly - dinosaurs, stars, hearts. Glitter glue smeared on parts. The colors don't stay in the lines. Innocent, joyful, imperfect. The rotary knob has a smiley face drawn on it. Displayed proudly on a refrigerator with magnets. Bright cheerful lighting.
styles.reasoning: Emotional warmth, innocence, unexpected charm
